info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 8:07AM EST until January 11 at 6:14PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Cartersville affecting Goochland, Powhatan and Cumberland Counties. James River At Richmond Westham affecting Henrico, City of Richmond and Chesterfield Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Prince Edward, Amelia and Cumberland Counties. Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Powhatan, Amelia and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Appomattox River above Farmville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Water approaches back of homes on Old Plank Rd, upstream of gage. Parking lot on Elm St. north of Main St. on southside of river begins to flood. At 18.0 feet, River Rd downstream of the gage near the railroad bridge begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:50 AM EST Thursday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:50 AM EST Thursday was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 14.4 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 05/05/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 345 PM EST.
